DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate time-related intracuff pressure volume change ( reflect pharyngeal pressure ) LT anesthesia N2O .
DOC.brief_title: Time - Related Cuff Pressure Volume Laryngeal Tube With Use Nitrous Oxide
DOC.detailed_description: Background : The laryngeal tube airway ( LT ) extraglottic airway device proximal distal conical cuff design secure patient 's airway either spontaneous breathe control ventilation . Application device use N2O may relate ischemic change oropharyngeal mucosa . The objective study investigate time-related intracuff pressure volume change ( reflect pharyngeal pressure ) LT anesthesia N2O . Methods : Seventy-five patient study use LT size 4 . N2O ( 66 % ) isoflurane use maintain anesthesia . Initial intracuff pressure volume record airway seal ventilation . Time-course change intracuff pressure follow record every 10 min . If intracuff pressure reach 100 cmH2O , cuff deflate initial intracuff pressure volume deflate air postoperative airway complication record .
DOC.criteria: American Society Anesthesiologist physical status I II Undergoing elective orthopedic surgery surgery breast general anesthesia expect duration 60 min Height < 155 > 180 cm ( use laryngeal tube size 4 ) Body mass index â‰¥35 kg/m2 Preexisting laryngotracheal disease Risk pulmonary aspiration gastric content .
